tn.text: Ezekiel reports a message that God gives him.
"Yahweh spoke his word." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:01:01|1:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This refers to Ezekiel. This phrase is the beginning of the words Yahweh spoke to Ezekiel. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:02:01|2:3]].

tn.ref: present a riddle and speak a parable
tn.text: "give them a puzzle to think about" or "tell this story as an illustration" (UDB)
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:03:01|3:1]].
"a very big eagle"
The word "pinion" means the outer end of the wings. Alternate translation: "the ends of its wings were long and full of feathers."
This refers to the eagle.

tn.ref: It broke off the tips of the branches
tn.text: "It broke off the highest part of the tree"
"took the top of the tree" or "took the branches"

tn.ref: he planted it in a city of merchants
tn.text: A merchant is a person who sells things. "He put it in a city that had many merchants" or "The eagle planted the top of the tree in a city that was known for its markets."
This is a continuation of the parable about the eagle.
The word "He" is the eagle in the parable.
"a field that was ready for seed to be planted in it." Alternate translations: "a fertile field" or "in good ground."

tn.ref: He planted it beside a large body of water
tn.text: "the eagle planted the seed in a place where there was a lot of water"

Willow trees grow in places where there is a lot of water. If the eagle planted the seed like a willow, it means that he planted it in a place with a lot of water. Alternate translation: "and planted the seed like a willow tree by water." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
"Then the seed began to grow into a plant"

tn.ref: a spreading vine low to the ground
tn.text: "a vine that spreads out on the ground"
The branches of the vine turned toward the eagle.
The roots of the vine grew under the eagle.
"That is how the vine grew"

tn.ref: produced branches and sent out shoots
tn.text: "grew branches and spread its shoots"
The introductory "but" shows that a different eagle is being describe than the one before.
The eagle is large, powerful, and impressive bird.
The word "Behold" here alerts us to pay attention to the surprising information that follows.

tn.ref: This vine turned its roots toward the eagle
tn.text: AT: "The roots of the vine grew toward the eagle"
AT: "so the eagle would water the vine" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
AT: "the first eagle had planted the vine."

tn.ref: beside a large body of water
tn.text: AT: "in a place where there was a lot of water"

tn.ref: so it would produce branches and sprout fruit, to become a magnificent vine
tn.text: "so that the vine would grow branches and fruit and be an impressive vine"
AT: "It will not prosper." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Will he not pull up its roots and pluck out its fruit so all of its growth of leaves will wither away?
tn.text: AT: "He will pull up its roots and pluck out its fruit so all of its growth of leaves will wither away." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
The word "behold!" here adds emphasis to what follows. ("indeed!", "look!" or "listen!" or "pay attention to what I am about to tell you!"
AT: "It will not grow." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Will it not wither when the eastern wind touches it?
tn.text: AT: "It will wither when the eastern wind touches it." (See [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]]).
"Yahweh spoke his word." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:01:01|1:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: Do you not know what these things mean?
tn.text: AT: "You should know what these things mean." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
"Look!" or "Listen!" or "Pay attention to what I am about to tell you!"
Yahweh speaks about the king of Jerusalem rebelling against the king of Babylon.
AT: "He will certainly not succeed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Will the one doing these things escape?
tn.text: AT: "The one doing these things will not escape!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: If he breaks the covenant, will he escape?
tn.text: AT: "If he breaks the covenant, he will certainly not escape!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
Yahweh speaking about the king of Jerusalem.

tn.ref: mighty army and assembling of many men for war
tn.text: These two phrases mean basically the same thing and emphasize how large and strong Pharaoh's army is. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
Here the word "him" refers to the king of Judah.
this refers to a tower with ladders that can be placed next to a wall and allow soldiers to get over the wall and into the city.
"Behold" adds emphasis to what follows. AT: "Indeed."

tn.ref: reached out with his hand to make a promise
tn.text: This refers to taking hold of another person's hand as a sign of friendship and agreement.

tn.ref: was it not my oath that he despised and my covenant that he broke?
tn.text: "it was my oath that the king of Jerusalem despised and my covenant that he broke." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]]).

tn.ref: I will bring his punishment on his head
tn.text: AT: "I will punish him." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
AT: "be killed by Babylon's army" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Yahweh speaking about Jerusalem like it's a branch planted in the mountains of Israel.
"grow new branches"
Yahweh speaks about trees like they are cities.

tn.ref: Then all the trees of the field will know that I am Yahweh
tn.text: (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
(See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
when a plant dries up and dies.
